alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 28 at 10:33PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following areas, Lenawee, Livingston, Macomb, Monroe, Oakland, St. Clair, Washtenaw and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 6 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A very moist airmass coupled with the build up of instability today will likely lead to showers and thunderstorms overnight. Rainfall totals around 1 inch can be expected for some areas with the potential exists for localized totals of 3 inches or more if the training of thunderstorms occurs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
